todos.title: Work Quadrant
todos.body: Work can be classified as important, not important, urgent, and not urgent.  Your time should be focused on the important and not urgent.  Set goals so that you don’t spend time on the not important, regardless whether it is urgent or not urgent.

todos.title: Why
todos.body: Great teams understand the true meaning for what they are doing and rally behind a single cause.

todos.title: Language
todos.body: Great teams speak a different language.

todos.title: Value Spotters
todos.body: Great teams see value that others miss.

todos.title: Scouting
todos.body: Great teams improve through scouting other successful people and teams.

todos.title: Roadmap
todos.body: Great teams have a roadmap for success.

todos.title: Mentors
todos.body: Great teams encourage mentoring.  Working with someone that is more or equally skilled than you in an area.

todos.title: Depth
todos.body: Great teams create and retain depth.

todos.title: Feel it Moments
todos.body: Great teams build feel it moments that help them understand the importance of what they are doing.

todos.title: Camaraderie
todos.body: Great teams build camaraderie amongst the members.

todos.title: Pitfalls of Success
todos.body: Great teams avoid the pitfalls of success.

todos.title: Culture
todos.body: Great teams allow culture to shape recruiting.

todos.title: Issues
todos.body: Great teams manage dysfunction, friction, and strong personalities.
